{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3608255,"name":"6894 Lead prog/driver","username":"Mochatitan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mochatitan/{size}/237112_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-30T17:52:12.544Z","cooked":"

I am trying to animate our robot scoring in blender, and I want to import not only the game field, but also a reef station. However the files it gives me are some strange SLDPRT format and I have never used solidworks. How can i get this as a file readable by blender?

Update: it worked CAD assistant software can convert .STEP files into .gltf files

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-05-01T04:03:30.640Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":77.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":500962,"topic_slug":"how-to-get-the-reef-as-a-blender-import","display_username":"6894 Lead prog/driver","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-get-the-reef-as-a-blender-import/500962/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3608268,"name":"","username":"person4268","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/22d042/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-30T18:00:17.071Z","cooked":"

Those are solidworks cad files. Iâ€™d recommend starting from the onshape field and either:

  • Using its export functionality to export to STEP, then use CAD Assistant to convert to gltf or another format of your choice. According to the AdvantageScope documentation, this produces slightly more efficient models.
  • Export directly to gltf in Onshape or to another format of your choice.

That being said, exporting to gltf and importing in blender creates a ton of collections that are really annoying to deal with, so this probably isnâ€™t the best way.

I have found STEP to be useless for the field cad imports when ive done my renders. I dont remember if i use an OBJ or an alternate file, will double check next time im at my desktop.
